title: Chicken Couscous Tfaya (Moroccan Couscous With Braised Chicken)
full_text:
Chicken Couscous Tfaya (Moroccan Couscous With Braised Chicken)
Close
Jump to recipe
Cook
60 mins
Total
60 mins
Serves
6
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)

Directions
For the Chicken:
In a large heavy-bottomed pot or large Dutch oven, heat oil and butter over medium heat until butter is melted and shimmering. Add onions, turmeric, ginger, saffron (if using), salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and mixture is fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Add chicken and mix to combine with onions and spices, then add stock or broth and cilantro stem bundle.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until chicken registers 175 to 185℉ on an instant-read, about 40 to 45 minutes. Discard cilantro bundle and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
For the T’faya Sauce:
Once chicken is simmering on low, in a large skillet, heat oil and butter over medium-low heat until butter is melted and shimmering. Add sliced onions, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft and translucent, 15 to 25 minutes. Add drained raisins, stock, honey, cinnamon, salt, and pepper and simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently, until most of liquid has evaporated and the onions are golden brown and jammy, 15 to 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
For Serving:
Place warm cooked couscous on a large serving platter or individual plates, top with chicken and some of the broth, and spoon a generous serving of t’faya sauce over the top. Garnish with toasted sliced almonds and reserved cilantro leaves. Transfer any leftover broth to individual serving bowls and serve on the side.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Special Equipment
Large heavy-bottomed pot or large Dutch oven, large skillet, fine-mesh strainer
Notes
To soak the raisin, in a heat safe bowl, add raisins and pour boiling water over them until covered. Let sit for 10 minutes, then drain in a fine-mesh strainer.
Make-Ahead and Storage
Leftovers can be refrigerated together in an airtight container for up to 4 days. To reheat, transfer to a baking dish and warm in a 350℉ (175℃) oven until warm.
